The central bank acknowledged that the recovery has leveled off in recent months.</span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/27/four-theories-attempt-explain-gamestopification-markets?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Whose Stock Is It Anyway?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Drew Carey meme" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zODY5L2RyZXdfY2FyZXlfbWVtZS5qcGVnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Toby Howell</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Over the past week, the business world’s attention has been hijacked wholesale by an army of amateur traders looking to make fools of the traditional finance industry. Yesterday brought more absurdity:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>After a 135% gain, GameStop stock closed at $348/share. One week ago it was at $43 and last summer it was at $4.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>AMC Entertainment shares exploded 301%. No, people aren’t going to the movies more often.</span></li>
</ul>
<div class="c-message_kit__gutter">
<div class="c-message_kit__gutter__right" data-qa="message_content">
<div class="c-message_kit__blocks c-message_kit__blocks--rich_text">
<div class="c-message__message_blocks c-message__message_blocks--rich_text">
<div class="p-block_kit_renderer" data-qa="block-kit-renderer">
<div class="p-block_kit_renderer__block_wrapper p-block_kit_renderer__block_wrapper--first">
<div class="p-rich_text_block" dir="auto">
<p class="p-rich_text_section" style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The run-up in GameStop was so dramatic that short-seller Citron Research, which bet on the stock to drop, was forced to <a href="https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/citron-gamestop-reddit-short-position-covered-loss-reddit-andrew-left-2021-1-1030009872?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">close out</a> most of its position “at a loss of 100%,” according to managing partner Andrew Left.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Let’s get deep</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There’s a general feeling that the GameStop saga speaks to something larger about the nature of financial markets, and even our culture. To try to make sense of it all, we’ve distilled some of the most popular theories that...try to make sense of it all.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1. The “stick it to the man” theory: </strong>This theory suggests that these traders are motivated primarily by their disdain for “suits,” the longtime wardens of Wall Street, who, Redditors argue, exploited the little guy to get filthy rich. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>As Bloomberg’s John Authers </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2021-01-27/gamestop-short-squeeze-is-rage-against-the-financial-machine?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a></span><span>, “The people investing today are driven by righteous anger, about generational injustice, about what they see as the corruption and unfairness of the way banks were bailed out in 2008 without having to pay legal penalties later, and about lacerating poverty and inequality.” </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2. The “everyone’s super bored” theory: </strong>Without much else to do during the pandemic, people have turned to the stock market as a form of entertainment...and to make a lot of money. Last summer, individual investors accounted for roughly <a href="https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/retail-investors-quarter-of-stock-market-coronavirus-volatility-trading-citadel-2020-7-1029382035?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">20% of stock market activity</a> on average, up from 10% in 2019.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">3. The “Robinhood” theory: </strong>The rise of the amateur investor can be directly linked back to Robinhood, the app that pioneered no-fee trading and empowered individuals to influence the stock market like never before.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">4. The “memeification of society” theory: </strong>Some observers have linked the behavior of Reddit’s trading army to other online communities that engage in “astroturfing” campaigns. “If you can create enough hype around something, through memes, conspiracy theories, and harassment campaigns, you can manifest it into reality via capital,” Ryan Broderick <a href="https://www.garbageday.email/p/happy-birthday-guy-fieri?token=eyJ1c2VyX2lkIjo0NjIyNTQsInBvc3RfaWQiOjMxNzc1NDUyLCJfIjoiUFg0THoiLCJpYXQiOjE2MTE3NzcwMzIsImV4cCI6MTYxMTc4MDYzMiwiaXNzIjoicHViLTkzMTciLCJzdWIiOiJwb3N0LXJlYWN0aW9uIn0.voNdjyjNIyxuI9R3v-pwobcM_f-u_qHSBD64__JbU-Y&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STOCKS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/27/gamestops-recent-rise-regulators-snooping-around?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
But Is It Legal?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="GameStop under a magnifying glass" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zODcwL2dhbWVzdG9wLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like Mark McGwire when he returned from the offseason with a neck the size of a tree trunk, GameStop’s stratospheric rally has <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-26/reddit-fueled-rallies-like-gamestop-s-defy-easy-crackdown-by-sec?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">caught the attention</a> of regulators.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">White House press secretary Jen Psaki said yesterday that President Biden’s economic team, including Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen, were “monitoring the situation.” The SEC also put out a statement saying it was keeping tabs on the “on-going market volatility.” </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Will there be any action? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Probably not. Without clear signs of fraudulent behavior—like buying a stock for the sole purpose of pushing the price up, then selling it—regulators can’t prosecute brazen enthusiasm alone. That’s not to say there is nothing risky about what’s going on; Massachusetts regulator William Galvin <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/27/gamestop-speculation-is-danger-to-whole-market-massachusetts-regulator.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told CNBC</a> that the mania around GameStop “undermines the system” and could shake confidence in the integrity of the entire US stock market. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> To make sure retail investors don’t roll too many gutter balls, online brokerages are setting up bumpers of their own. TD Ameritrade placed “several restrictions” on some transactions involving GameStop, AMC, and other r/WallStreetBets favorites yesterday. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EARNINGS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/27/tesla-facebook-apple-earnings-big-can-numbers-get?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Fine, We Can Talk About Something Else
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple, Tesla, and Facebook, companies we used to think were interesting before GameStop happened, all reported earnings yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Apple </strong>is to business as the Andy Reid-coached Chiefs are to football offenses. It had its most profitable quarter ever ($28.8 billion), and revenue topped $100 billion for the first time.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Sales in every product category increased by double-digit percentage points. Plus, revenue in Greater China gained 57%. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tesla’s</strong> <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/27/tesla-tsla-earnings-q4-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">report</a> was a tale of two lines: The top one ($10.7 billion in revenue) beat Wall Street’s expectations, while the bottom line missed. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Still, that bottom line </span><span><em>was</em></span><span> more than zero, meaning 2020 was Tesla’s </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/tesla-tsla-4q-earnings-report-2020-11611708257?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first profitable</a></span><span> full year ever. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Elon Musk's EV company fell just 450 cars shy of its ambitious yearly target of half a million vehicle deliveries. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Facebook </strong><a href="https://www.wsj.com/livecoverage/apple-facebook-tesla-earnings-january-2021?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">posted</a> record numbers for both revenue and profit...but warned of storm clouds ahead, including 1) possible curbs on user data collection and 2) the pandemic-era e-commerce boost backsliding as vaccines roll out. </p>

</table>
<img alt="Game of Risk, played in oil barrels " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMzkyL2dhbWVfb2Zfcmlza19wbGF5ZWRfaW5fb2lsX2JhcnJlbHMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, President Biden <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/27/business/fracking-ban-biden-federal-leasing/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">issued</a> a moratorium on new oil and gas leases on federal land, following through on a campaign pledge. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What does that mean?</strong> Like the pronunciation of “pecan” or “caramel,” it depends on where you come from. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For drillers in states where federal land comprises the bulk of drilling areas, like New Mexico and Wyoming, it’s a big problem. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For drillers in states where most drilling land is state- or private individual-owned, like Pennsylvania and Texas, it’s not such a big deal, though it could complicate things like the construction of new pipelines. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>For climate activists: It’s a step in the right direction. Some have pushed Biden to take a bigger swipe at the fossil-fuel industry by banning fracking, which he’s opposed to, but many applauded yesterday’s move. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Reality check:</strong> Many energy operators went on a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/biden-to-suspendnew-federal-oil-and-gas-leasing-11611672331?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">permit-buying spree</a> in the final months of the Trump administration, so they won’t be affected by the freeze until further down the line. But...they will be affected, and energy industry groups have already brought legal challenges.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">
Vaccine Check-In

</h1>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Our World in Data</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This map from <a href="https://ourworldindata.org/covid-vaccinations?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=sendto_newslettertest&stream=top&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Our World in Data</a> (incredible site, btw) shows the number of Covid-19 doses administered per 100 people in every country. If you squint and zero in on the Middle East, you can identify the leader Israel and runner-up United Arab Emirates.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s the top 10 as of yesterday evening:</p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Israel: </strong></span><span>49.1 doses per 100 people</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">UAE: </strong></span><span>27.9</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">United Kingdom: </strong></span><span>11.3</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Bahrain: </strong></span><span>8.5</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">US: </strong></span><span>7.1</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Italy: </strong></span><span>2.6</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Germany: </strong></span><span>2.4</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">France: </strong></span><span>1.8</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">China: </strong></span><span>1.6</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Russia: </strong></span><span>0.7</span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"></strong><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The public health world is <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/25/world/middleeast/israels-vaccine-data.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">looking to Israel</a> for signs of vaccine effectiveness. And the early results are encouraging: Vaccines (even after just one dose) appear to be causing significant drops in Covid infections.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But for now, the new coronavirus strain is keeping Israel's economy shut down—the government <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSKBN29T0A4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">temporarily banned</a> all international flights.</p>

FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

Brew's Bookshelf

<img alt="books" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODIvYnJld19zX2Jvb2tzaGVsZi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This is about the time when we start leaving New Year’s resolutions in the rearview mirror. If you could also use a push to stay on track, try checking out one of these books.</p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780735211292?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Atomic Habits</em></a></span><span> by James Clear is a Bookshelf repeat...but also just a top-notch guide to hacking your habits one day at a time. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780593135334?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Read This For Inspiration</em></a></span><span> by Ashly Perez packages beautiful illustrations with bite-size nuggets of wisdom to help you find daily motivation and, well, inspiration.  </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781101971109?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>New Power</em></a></span><span> by Jeremy Heimans and Henry Timms examines how systems of power have changed in the modern, networked era and the new rules of success you need to play by. </span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Looking for something else? <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brew’s Bookshelf</a> has plenty of recommendations for other business-related reads. </p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">
Three Headlines and a Lie
</font></a>

</td>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yes, the stock market has been crazy...but if we’re being frank so has the rest of the world. Three of these absurd headlines are real, while one is made up. Can you spot the fake? </p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Geologist </span><span><a href="https://www.goodnewsnetwork.org/geologist-finds-cookie-monster-rock/?fbclid=IwAR1wi1RAr-mI7509jAhVcnW7aRJw_qPw04YWJmNGiqVYgv9aMKUoBqVfaM8&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">finds</a></span><span> rare formation inside rock that looks exactly like Cookie Monster on Sesame Street"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Psychedelics ETF to </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-26/psychedelics-etf-world-s-first-seizes-on-mental-health-uses?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launch</a></span><span> after sector attracts Thiel’s money"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Beijing’s </span><span><a href="https://www.vice.com/en/article/7k9m9d/china-is-using-anal-swabs-to-detect-covid-infections?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">latest weapon</a></span><span> in its war on COVID-19: anal swabs”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“‘We’re living in a simulation’: the winning Mega Millions lottery ticket </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/7MBoS2kez5I8o/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">perfectly matches</a></span><span> the mysterious numbers sequence from the TV show ‘Lost’”</span>
</li>
</ol>
</td>

670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" Howell\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOver the past week, the business world’s attention has been hijacked wholesale by an army of amateur traders looking to make fools of the traditional finance industry. Yesterday brought more absurdity:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAfter a 135% gain, GameStop stock closed at $348/share. One week ago it was at $43 and last summer it was at $4.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAMC Entertainment shares exploded 301%. No, people aren’t going to the movies more often.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"c-message_kit__gutter\"\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"c-message_kit__gutter__right\" data-qa=\"message_content\"\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"c-message_kit__blocks c-message_kit__blocks--rich_text\"\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"c-message__message_blocks c-message__message_blocks--rich_text\"\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"p-block_kit_renderer\" data-qa=\"block-kit-renderer\"\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"p-block_kit_renderer__block_wrapper p-block_kit_renderer__block_wrapper--first\"\u003e\r\n\u003cdiv class=\"p-rich_text_block\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\r\n\u003cp class=\"p-rich_text_section\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe run-up in GameStop was so dramatic that short-seller Citron Research, which bet on the stock to drop, was forced to \u003ca href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/citron-gamestop-reddit-short-position-covered-loss-reddit-andrew-left-2021-1-1030009872?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclose out\u003c/a\u003e most of its position “at a loss of 100%,” according to managing partner Andrew Left.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLet’s get deep\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere’s a general feeling that the GameStop saga speaks to something larger about the nature of financial markets, and even our culture. To try to make sense of it all, we’ve distilled some of the most popular theories that...try to make sense of it all.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1. The “stick it to the man” theory: \u003c/strong\u003eThis theory suggests that these traders are motivated primarily by their disdain for “suits,” the longtime wardens of Wall Street, who, Redditors argue, exploited the little guy to get filthy rich. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAs Bloomberg’s John Authers \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2021-01-27/gamestop-short-squeeze-is-rage-against-the-financial-machine?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, “The people investing today are driven by righteous anger, about generational injustice, about what they see as the corruption and unfairness of the way banks were bailed out in 2008 without having to pay legal penalties later, and about lacerating poverty and inequality.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2. The “everyone’s super bored” theory: \u003c/strong\u003eWithout much else to do during the pandemic, people have turned to the stock market as a form of entertainment...and to make a lot of money. Last summer, individual investors accounted for roughly \u003ca href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/retail-investors-quarter-of-stock-market-coronavirus-volatility-trading-citadel-2020-7-1029382035?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e20% of stock market activity\u003c/a\u003e on average, up from 10% in 2019.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e3. The “Robinhood” theory: \u003c/strong\u003eThe rise of the amateur investor can be directly linked back to Robinhood, the app that pioneered no-fee trading and empowered individuals to influence the stock market like never before.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e4. The “memeification of society” theory: \u003c/strong\u003eSome observers have linked the behavior of Reddit’s trading army to other online communities that engage in “astroturfing” campaigns. “If you can create enough hype around something, through memes, conspiracy theories, and harassment campaigns, you can manifest it into reality via capital,” Ryan Broderick \u003ca href=\"https://www.garbageday.email/p/happy-birthday-guy-fieri?token=eyJ1c2VyX2lkIjo0NjIyNTQsInBvc3RfaWQiOjMxNzc1NDUyLCJfIjoiUFg0THoiLCJpYXQiOjE2MTE3NzcwMzIsImV4cCI6MTYxMTc4MDYzMiwiaXNzIjoicHViLTkzMTciLCJzdWIiOiJwb3N0LXJlYWN0aW9uIn0.voNdjyjNIyxuI9R3v-pwobcM_f-u_qHSBD64__JbU-Y\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecaught the attention\u003c/a\u003e of regulators.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhite House press secretary Jen Psaki said yesterday that President Biden’s economic team, including Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen, were “monitoring the situation.” The SEC also put out a statement saying it was keeping tabs on the “on-going market volatility.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWill there be any action? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eProbably not. Without clear signs of fraudulent behavior—like buying a stock for the sole purpose of pushing the price up, then selling it—regulators can’t prosecute brazen enthusiasm alone. That’s not to say there is nothing risky about what’s going on; Massachusetts regulator William Galvin \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/27/gamestop-speculation-is-danger-to-whole-market-massachusetts-regulator.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold CNBC\u003c/a\u003e that the mania around GameStop “undermines the system” and could shake confidence in the integrity of the entire US stock market. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e To make sure retail investors don’t roll too many gutter balls, online brokerages are setting up bumpers of their own. TD Ameritrade placed “several restrictions” on some transactions involving GameStop, AMC, and other r/WallStreetBets favorites yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereport\u003c/a\u003e was a tale of two lines: The top one ($10.7 billion in revenue) beat Wall Street’s than zero, meaning 2020 was Tesla’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/tesla-tsla-4q-earnings-report-2020-11611708257?utm_source=morning_brew\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, President Biden \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/27/business/fracking-ban-biden-federal-leasing/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eissued\u003c/a\u003e a moratorium on new oil and gas leases on federal land, following through on a campaign pledge. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat does that mean?\u003c/strong\u003e Like the pronunciation of “pecan” or “caramel,” it depends on where you come from. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFor drillers in states where federal land comprises the bulk of drilling areas, like New Mexico and Wyoming, it’s a big problem. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFor drillers in states where most drilling land is state- or private individual-owned, like Pennsylvania and Texas, it’s not such a big deal, though it could complicate things like the construction of new pipelines. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFor climate activists: It’s a step in the right direction. Some have pushed Biden to take a bigger swipe at the fossil-fuel industry by banning fracking, which he’s opposed to, but many applauded yesterday’s move. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eReality check:\u003c/strong\u003e Many energy operators went on a \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/biden-to-suspendnew-federal-oil-and-gas-leasing-11611672331?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epermit-buying spree\u003c/a\u003e in the final months of the Trump administration, so they won’t be affected by the freeze until further down the line.
